sentence: "Your tibialis anterior is damaged."
"Sadly, he's in the West."
"Sorry."
"It's just a joke."
"It's nice to see you again, Rainie."
Uh oh. I smell trouble.
Then all of a sudden, I sensed an incredible amount of pressure and all of us summoned and drew our weapons, pointing them to each other, then the table and chairs were suddenly frozen.
"No. You sound like your dad—a leader."
That place is too quiet that I tend to hear a lot of buzzing and humming, plus the tension in the surrounding is too high.
"Of course. Her team successfully infiltrated the Shinigami's base and retrieved her comrades' eyes."
"That's great."
"I see. I guess there's no need to worry about you."
"Thanks for this, by the way. It warms me up since we're living on a cold place."
"Nice. I didn't even notice it," then he tossed it to Reiji and he caught it.
"That it's dangerous. She's worried about us."
"Don't let go," Hiro said. And the next thing I knew, the Black Dimension was already closing and I saw the pain in his expression.
"You almost died."
She lost her husband and dearest friends, and she didn't see her son for fifteen years.
"What did you do? Two of your fatal points are in dire state."
"N-no way. My eyes are not that..."
They are in trouble.
I can hear the two of them cursing inside their head while heading to the building in front of them.
I smiled triumphantly. I fulfilled my role.
But I don't think I can last any longer because all of them lunged at me.
These Shinigamis are going to kill me.
"What the hell is this creepy feeling?"
"One more word and I'll behead you."
"If you could, old hag."
"You're going with us, whether you like it or not."
I have a bad feeling about this.
"Go all out. Erase this place where she suffered a lot."
"Chase him!"
"I won't let you touch him," I whispered as I released the arrow from the bow.
It hit the back of the Shinigami and Darwin looked at me with a proud expression.

As I was looking at my father taking down the building, I felt a sense of relief and sadness. Seeing his actions, I know that he wanted to do this after all this time. He wanted to erase this place where my mother suffered.
"Yeah. I'm scared to know the truth."
"I really admire you, Mama. You're so strong. And even if nobody's talking about you here because they said you were a curse, you will always be my hero. It's just sad that you're not here anymore."
"She died in his arms."
"I don't know," he said and I saw the sadness in his eyes. "These past few months, I've been recollecting some unfamiliar memories."
"But remembering is just as worse as forgetting."
"His cries filled the place."
"Still unstable but we're recovering. Thanks to all of you."
"Wow. Thank you, Darwin. I'm going to use this."
I'm glad that it didn't turn out that way. I still have him at my side.
"I'm back, Vince," I whispered as I caressed his grave.
His death still haunts me and gives me nightmares.
"Even though a lot of things happened, I'm glad that I still have the both of you," I said while keeping my tears from falling. "So please...don't you ever dare to die on me, too."
Coming back here and being with them made those memories vivid. If I could only rewind the time we were the happiest... If I could only stop the time once again...

However, after hearing his thoughts, I felt sad and hurt because he's starting to remember the war fifteen years ago when he was just a one-year old baby. Maybe subconsciously, he pushed them away to the depths of his mind but the second war triggered them to resurface.
"He chose to protect you. He did everything to save our future so instead of being sorry, be thankful to your father. Will you do that for me, Nathan?"
My tears fell as I remember our happy moments together and I feel miserable because all these memories keep coming back...but he never does. And he never will.
"Tss. I want to get out of this place immediately. Why do I have to be with these people? I'm going to kick that old fart's ass when I get back."
"N-No, sir."
"Damn you, old fart, are you playing with me?!"
"Well, being curious isn't bad."
Wow. That's handy but a bit sad. Will he also forget people after a long time? Will his memories fade away?
"You look so confident and calculating outside but deep inside, you're anxious and insecure of yourself."
"Sir Eiichi!" I squeaked and he just smiled at me.
Beyond that, wild and vicious creatures freely roam around to serve as our external protection from unwelcomed visitors. However, we are not exempted from their attacks.
Without any warning, something monstrous charged towards me.
I immediately jumped to the branches of the tree beside me and the creature banged its head straight to the bark. The tree shook tremendously and I almost fell directly to that thing.
His low growl made my skin crawl and when the moonlight illuminated the surroundings, my stomach tightened due to the creature's unsightly appearance.

Possessing a broad and long husk, it looks like a boar but the size of lion. Its jaws and teeth are those of a shark while its body is covered with sharp hairs. Looking at it for a few seconds made me nauseous and panic started to engulf my senses.
Just when I thought that one monster is enough to scare the heck out of me, two . . . three . . . six . . . six more appeared and surrounded us. Terror dominated my mind and body.
"Shit, I said stop it!" Mitsuo shouted and he kneeled so that I can see him. "These creatures can smell fear and they are attracted to it. If you don't want to attract more of them, calm yourself!"
"Let me hold this for a while," I breathed. "Please." He stayed silent but after a few seconds, he moved and positioned his back in front of me.
"Him?" A taunting smile formed on her lips.
Hearing the Council of Elders made my skin crawl. They are a group of advisers and counselors who help the leaders with their decisions and rules.
Their loyalty to the tribe is absolute but that's also the reason why they are perceived as cold and heartless.
They will do anything to protect the Senshins and this place, even if it poses harm and danger to others.

"But I am not someone you can follow carelessly," he said with a serious tone and I can feel the goosebumps all over my body. The first thing that came into my mind is to escape but I don't want to be seen as a coward. Not by him.

I can see a huge, barren field, with crows, ravens and vultures flying around it. The sky was red because of the setting sun and it heightened the eerie scenery. I can also hear voices, some of them are angry and the others are wailing their hearts out. Standing in the middle of the field was an old man holding his weapon—a bardiche.

"Hey." I stepped forward and slapped him hard. "Call me anything but stupid because I am not." After getting my fan from my side, I pointed it at him. "Remember that and I hope it won't fade away from your memories."
We both went quiet after that. I don't know what happened but after a few seconds, we smiled at each other. And this time, I know that something has changed between us.
"Thanks, Naomi," he said. "I owe you one."
"He's annoying. Calling me stupid and funny. Who is he anyway? Damn him."
Even though she teased me nonstop a while ago, I smiled when I see her peaceful expression. Meeting with Koharu after a long time must have made her really happy.

I was already on page 13 when I read that part and I was amazed because those chemicals can induce the emotion called love. The science part is interesting but I'm more excited to read the psychological interpretation of it.
"Love is dangerous, and is just next door to death."
"Maybe coming here is a wrong decision after all. Damn it, old fart. This is all your fault."
"So you heard it, huh?" he calmly said and his tone was bone-chilling.
"Thank you," I said and he smiled in return.

I can't remember anything from my parents but my mother's favorite line: A person's memories can be seen clearly through his eyes. She's right, because right now, Mitsuo's memories flooded my own mind. A sea of blood, hundreds of corpses, people's cry all over the place, and him in the middle of all of that. Using all of my remaining mental strength, I shifted my gaze from his eyes to his wound, and I fell on my knees, panting heavily.
"Yes and it's creepy."
"You should learn from the expert," I said with confidence.
"So our theory is really true," I said, amazed by the words written on the books.
We simultaneously called their names because their presence are too overwhelming to the point that it's already suffocating.
"Oohh. It has been a long time since you've been this distracted," Akira suddenly said and she looked at me with a taunting smile.
After reading that entry, Akemi and Mitsuo, with their menacing faces, appeared in my mind and I immediately shuddered. The thought of them being Shinigamis was too frightening and disturbing.
"It's better if you do not know," he said and his contemptuous smile frustrated me.
I was dead serious about that but he stared at me, as if I just said something ridiculous, and after a few seconds, he burst out laughing.
Is this his concept of closure? I don't even know what he meant by this. I don't understand him and I don't like the feeling of being confused.
"Forget about me," he said and I felt a twinge in my chest.
"Please don't." After hearing that, I felt hurt. For the first time, I was broken.

I like him, I had admitted that, but I don't think it was right. Yes, he's a great and gentle person despite of his appearance and action but his memories . . . those thoughts that I have seen showed otherwise.
His glaring eyes, cunning smile, his clothes soaked in people's blood and the sword he was holding . . . his memories made me shudder in fear.
I was thinking of a plan to subdue him but I immediately froze when I saw the body lying behind him. The guy's throat was slashed and his blood painted the park's cobblestones.
The murderer turned around and locked eyes with me. When I saw his scarred face, I almost stopped breathing.
I was paralyzed with fear and confusion but his raging, intense, green eyes showed no sympathy.

"Run away! Now! He's going to kill everyone!" With much fear in my voice, and I wasn't faking it, my warning was effective. All of them scrambled away from the scene and after a few seconds, the guy, the dead body and me were the only ones left.
"You . . ." He pointed at me again. "You're like me! You can't deceive me!" He roared with laughter that made my skin crawl but it was short-lived.
He looked like a mad man and I was beyond scared. I reached for my fan but I went rigid when he hollered at me.
"You're the same as them!" he roared and held the knife with both of his hands, aiming at my chest. "You want to kill me! Die! Die!"
He turned around and when our eyes met, my body convulsed, as if the fear and panic I should've felt earlier took effect just now. He knelt in front of me and gently pulled me in for a hug.
I didn't know why but tears started falling from my eyes. I slapped his back because I was frustrated, confused and scared at the same time but he didn't complain. Instead, he pulled me closer.
"And this is why I don't want you to get close to me," he breathed and I felt the thumping of his heart against his chest.
"But I'm glad you're safe. I'm really glad and thankful."
"Liar," I said between my sobs.
Our conversation was suddenly cut off by loud thud and Akira's scream. When I turned around, Akemi was already laying unconscious on the floor.
Thank you, but I shouldn't be loved. I might hurt and break you so give your heart to someone who could really protect you. But your feelings toward me, I'll treasure it.

Even though my senses were dwindling, I felt the tears running down my cheeks and I saw his agonizing smile. I wanted to say something but my voice betrayed me and those were the last words I heard before my consciousness slipped away.
"They're gone," he said in a soft voice but his words resonated across the room. "And they're not coming back anymore."
"So she's really a Shinigami," Akira said and she looked dejected.
His retort made me smile a little and I saw his lips moving, too. I missed the way we tease each other and I'm glad that he can still think thoroughly even though we're in a rough situation.
"That place?" He gave me a menacing smile that sent chills down my spine.

I was about to move but then I felt a presence around me. My senses were heightened by the anxiety and I slowly readied my weapon. My body tensed when I heard a sinister laugh but the park remained deserted.
Suddenly, the hair on my nape tingled and someone spoke near my ear.
My whole body seared, as if I was thrown into the fire. I can't breathe properly and my senses were slowly fading.
The Shinigami pulled my hair and his face came into view. I don't know if I was hallucinating but his face was full of scars that I can't distinguish his features anymore.
The intensity of his gaze was enough to make me nauseous but his words stung me like a venom and I remembered the memory I have seen earlier.

My heart beat increased its pace and it felt like both of my adrenaline and serotonin levels heightened. Just when I needed a diversion from all of these feelings, he suddenly reached his gun and fired at the left side.

The voice behind me sent shivers down my spine and the only thing I could do was using my sixth sense. I managed to stop the time around me but only for three seconds to reposition myself. When the time reached its limit, the Huntres shoved his shadow-like dagger to the place where I was three seconds ago.
I heard him chuckle and that made me smile a little. I like this side of him more.
"Yes. Maybe I should've told you this before. Maybe you wouldn't get yourself involved with me after this, and maybe your feelings toward me will disappear and turn into something else."

His dumbfounded expression was replaced with a contemptuous smile and my heart has suddenly increased its pace. I recalled the reactions involved in attraction and love and this is one of the markers, unless I was feeling fear.
"Save yourself," he suddenly said and that made me stop for a second. "I can't swim and I'll just be a burden to you. So please, leave me here and save—"
"Thank you for not letting me go. Thank you for letting me see your face after that endless darkness."
"Because she's a bit different and somehow similar to me. I saw myself in her," he said and the way he looked at me made me jittery.

He didn't say anything but he gently pulled me toward him and the next thing I knew, he was already hugging me. My head was spinning and my heart was ready to burst any moment now but his warmth calmed me down.
"This is Shima, the island of the damned," he said and the cries and screams of agony of the people inhabiting it filled my ears.
I moved closer to him since the atmosphere felt disturbing and I don't want to be alone in this kind of place.

Consecutive roars from the huge lion and leopard in front greeted us and I was rendered motionless due to fear and confusion. Their bodies were twice larger than the normal ones and they looked more ferocious.

I almost forgot to breathe when he said that and I got more cautious because of the danger that this place could offer. Some of the plants and trees we passed by emit strange odor and chemicals that, according to him, could paralyze or cause hallucination.
All of a sudden, the two other guys grabbed both of my arms while the one who was speaking pointed his spear at Mitsuo.
"Mitsuo!" I called, frightened by the situation. I wanted to reach my fan but I couldn't move my arms due to their strength.
"What are you doing, Lionel?" Mitsuo snarled while glaring at the guy.
Lionel and Mitsuo both looked at me and I just wanted to go to his side. In this unfamiliar place and situation, Mitsuo was the only one I could depend on.
"I'm sorry," he said.

The guys dragged me away from them and I could feel the stinging pain from where they were holding me. Instead of yelling at them, I observed the surrounding and I almost gasped when I saw the crimson-colored ground.
"Curse you, fucking Jikko!" the guy yelled and he spat on the ground.

The Executioner swung his scythe and I immediately closed the window. The guy howled in anger but after a few seconds, it disappeared. My body convulsed, imaging the scenario that just happened outside.
I smiled at her and she looked at me with curiosity. She might be too young to understand the concept but still, I wanted to tell her.
"Don't involve yourself with him anymore," he said with his piercing gaze, his scythe pointed at my direction.
My body went rigid when I heard my whole name from his mouth. How did he . . .

Panic started to arise in my body as the volcanic ash and other matter coming out of the volcano. I ran towards the door, pounding it and screaming for help, but my voice was masked by the mass outcry happening inside my head.
"How dare you do this to me, Senshins! I'm going to kill all of you! Watch me!" the woman screamed while vultures, crows and ravens circled around her, her naked body covered with cuts and wounds.

I clutched my stomach when I saw the vultures lunging at her wounds, as if they were hastening her death. One of the crows targeted her eyes and I instinctively closed my eyes, imagining the scenario if it was me in her place.
Her wails and curses filled the air but my eyes flung open when I realized the owner of that voice—it was the Huntres we encountered on the sea.
"STOP! NO!" the Huntres shrieked. "I didn't mean it! Believe me! Please!"
I suddenly felt scared because unfamiliar memories were starting to fill and overwrite my mind and for a second, I couldn't remember my own memories anymore.
"For what reason?!" I pointed my fan at his direction and the memories I was trying to remember a while ago were becoming vivid.
I wanted to stop reading his memories but I found myself still looking through them until my parents' death. I clutched my chest because it felt like my heart would burst any second.
"You disgust me," I said. "How dare you question my parents' and our clan's loyalty when all they did was support the President!"
"It wasn't! Sir Hideyoshi treasured them as friends, and yet because of your doubts, he lost them . . . I lost them."
His words stung like poison and I couldn't take it anymore. I swung my fan at his direction, ready to slit his throat, but something restricted my hand.
When I saw him, the remaining strength I was holding onto dissolved and triggered my tears. He pulled me into his chest and I cried my heart out.
"Don't leave me here," I said, scared to lose my own thoughts again.

"All of the people here, the prisoners and even the Executioners, have their own share of madness. I thought I can protect you but I haven't considered your ability. It must've been hard for you. I'm sorry.
And I thought I was doing a great job of keeping it at the back of my mind.
Why are you crying?
"It's just that . . . I don't know how to face Hideo anymore," I said while remembering our childhood.
"I'm sorry for not telling you the truth," he said, breaking the silence.
My tears automatically fell after hearing those words, remembering the hardships my parents went through because of the Council's ideas.
"Why?" I asked, trying my best to stay calm even if my face and mind were already a mess.
"From the bottom of my heart, I am sorry for hurting you like this," he said while bowing for apology
"I'm sorry for not knowing the truth until now," I said with a shaky voice.
"I lived in solace while you were wrongly judged and killed. I'm sorry."
"But you know, it's nice that you're back," Michiko suddenly said while looking at Mitsuo.
"We already know about Shima after that jailbreak incident," Mayu added.
"But you made her suffer," Hideo said and that made us silent.
I'm really lucky to have these people in my life. To me, they are my family.
"Hideo . . ." I checked him and he seemed troubled. "Calm yourself."
"No one's leaving this place," Hideo warned and his eyes found her.
"I am done with all of you so stop this bullshit," she harshly said but I could read her mind.
"Yes," I breathed. I was afraid not for myself but for the life inside me. I do not know what to do.
"I'm sorry," he whispered.
I am not worthy to be someone's father. I don't deserve this. I—
But it's the truth. My hands were already soaked in people's blood. I've killed hundreds of people. Someone as filthy as me can't have something so pure.
"No. Sorry," he said and he hugged me.

"It's just that . . . I don't want the both of you to be labeled as an Executioner's wife and child. But I'll do anything to protect you so you don't need to worry. I made this choice so I will do anything to keep you out of danger."
Suddenly, I imagined the three of us walking together, our child in his arms while I look at them happily. It made me satisfied.
Yes, for he is the greatest gift you have given me, and a reminder that he should protect you when I'm not around.
"I hope we could attend this festival next year together with Nathan," I said and he just smiled.
"Me too." A smile was formed on my lips, "maybe she wants a younger brother and I think she's really good at taking care of others."
"I'm sorry for giving this kind of task to you," he said in an apologetic tone.
I promised that I wouldn't cry anymore after giving birth to Nathan but his words were stirring up my emotions.
"Of course," I said. "We've been helping each other since we were young. You don't need to worry."
"I don't want him to be labeled as an Executioner's child."
"What's happening?" I asked and I could sense the panic in my own voice.
"That's the warning for intruders," he said and he stood up.
"What in the world . . ." My voice disappeared after seeing the room in front of me.
"The hallway . . ." My voice dissolved into thin air when I saw Vince's expression.
I don't know the exact details but I'm sure it was the Black Dimension.
He's . . . in a state of coma.
"He's now fine but he needs rest," she said and I could see the tinge of guilt in her eyes. "You should rest, too."
"It suits you," I said and he gave me a confused look, "being a father, I mean."
"Stupid," I muttered while trying hard not to cry. "That was the best thing I've heard these past few weeks."
For a second, I was tempted to stop the time just to look at my family—the two guys who changed my world.
I stayed alert after she said that since our last encounter didn't go well.
I'm scared.
"Oh God. You're really here, Akemi."
"Rainie," she said with a smile. "How about your son?"
Naomi, please. I need to see him. I want to see him. Please.
"But I can say that you deserve to die because you said those things. Talk bad about her and you'll die by my hands."
"Idiot. Don't say that."
"Naomi, you don't have to do this,"Akemi said. "You have your own family to protect, so please . ."
Hideo! Please help him. Please—
"Don't touch them!" I yelled.
"I know you need to go to Akemi, but I have a favor to ask." Nathan started crying and he was holding onto his father's clothes.
"Sorry Nathan. Take care of your mother for me."
"No . . . Vince . . . don't say that . . ."
"I'm here. You should calm down and think carefully. You're safe so you do not need to worry." Those were the meanings of his knocks.
But I'm sorry, Nathalie, I don't think I can save you
"Sorry."
Don't say that! Please, don't say that.
"Please, just forget me," he weakly said. "Use my sixth sense, Nathalie."
What are you saying?
I don't want to cause you more pain.
Are you stupid? I'd rather live in pain than forget you.
How could he say those words to me? How could he say that I should forget him?
But I . . . but I can't live with you anymore and I'll hurt you even more.
I don't care. If you can't live with me, then I'll let you live in my memories.
"How can I forget someone like you?" I retorted and he smiled again.

Maybe it's because I was used to forget people every now and then that I thought everyone would also be like that. But you know what? If I could live another life, I'd still choose to remember you. Even if my own memories were erased, as long as you're still inside my head, it would be enough.'
"I will always remember you, Nathalie."
And those were the last words I heard from the guy who could forget everything.
I was too broken to function. In just one night, I lost a friend, my home and the most important person in my life.
I was useless. Powerless. If I only used my ability . . . if I only stayed by his side . . .
What's the use of this power if I can't even stop his death?
"I couldn't protect your mother so let me protect you instead," I said and it seemed like the rain has finally stopped. "Let's start a new life, Rainie. You and I."
"Okay. Thank you."
"Rainie, is that your name?" she asked and Rainie nodded.
Oh my God, Naomi.
"Happy birthday, Rainie," I would say every 31st of December.
They can never take the place of someone I've lost.
And every New Year's Eve, instead of staying up all night, I always cry myself to sleep.
I felt guilty and sorry because I could've done something to save them yet I wasn't aware of their situation.
We will see each other again at the right time. Goodbye for now, Nathalie.
"I'm sorry, Nathan," I sobbed, hugging him tighter and I felt his hand on my back. "I'm sorry."
I remember you, and that's enough for me. May I call you . . . Mom?
"My memories are just hard to control, so be careful of yours," I warned since his sixth sense allows him to remember everything.

Every minute, every hour and every day, I will always think of you. No matter how painful, I will always remember you just like what you said to me before you left because your memory is my home, my refuge.
"You will never be forgotten, Vince."
"Obviously, she's not listening."
Since the four of you already completed your core subjects, you only need to do that thing to graduate. I'm expecting good results from you.
"Stop feeding her lies, Kana," Hayate retorted, "or she'll believe in everything you say."
"Excuse me? I don't lie."
"Are you sure?" Hiroshi butted in while adjusting his glasses. "Do you want me to enumerate the lies you have said since you started living here?"
"Stop it, you idiots!" I said while glaring at those two.
Aren't you romantic?
"Okay, stop that or I'm not going to spend my time with you."
"Transferees," Sir Tora said, calling their attention. "Welcome to Tantei High."
I observed her tiny movements and the moment her eyes opened, I stood beside her bed.
"It's 6:07:43, Kana. The exact time you woke up," I said and she rolled her eyes at me..
"Oh, shut up."
"Goddamnit, J, it's just 6 AM. Are you nuts?"
"Morning," Hiroshi said, his hologram walking around our room.
"What the heck are you doing here? Pervert," she said and that made Hiroshi turn around.
"That meganerd," she grumbled while putting her clothes on.
What's with that thought?' he suddenly asked using his inner voice.
Why? Are you shy? Aren't you a cute kid?
"Don't you have a meeting to attend?" he said in a lower and colder tone.
"You brat! I practically raised you!"
"J, you really can't defeat that kid in argument," Kana commented.
"She just doesn't know how to handle him," Hayate added.
"Thank you very much," I sarcastically said and all of them laughed.

I actually have the habit of singling out the transferees during the first week and count them all. I would go to the administration office to confirm my inference and I've been getting accurate figures for three consecutive years. Sadly, I won't be able to do that this year.
"Well, I guess we have our first potential target," she said as we both watched the news beingplayed from there.
"Thank you"
"That damn murderer," the inspector growled while looking at the mutilated body on the ground
"Let them be," he said earlier. "They can help us. Trust me."
"What a brutal killer," Hiroshi commented while scanning the body with the device he invented to record the state of the body and which would be instantly sent to his server.
All of a sudden, I felt a chill down my spine, as if someone was staring at us from behind.
"Yeah. That bloodthirst is comparable to a Shinigami," I answered and I could feel it more intensely, being a Shinigami tracker and all.
"Wait," I warned.
"A Shinigami?" Hayate asked, taking a defensive stance.
"Yeah. I can sense that dimension."
"Kill them," she ordered and two more Shinigamis came out as she went back to that place.
He looked at Kana and just like what she did to me, she gave her a quick smile. "You're slow, meganerd."
"H-how did you . . ." His voice trailed off but after a few seconds, he gave him a quick smile. "As expected from you, Atama."
"What did you say, wimp?"
"Reina! Stop! Da—!"
"Stop . . ." I yelled while jumping toward him, "shooting us!"
"Who the hell is this? Fuck off"
"Fine! Just don't touch my family."
"Does that mean the murderer knows we're here?" Kana asked and the four of us raised our guards.
"I think we just found the killer and his motive," I muttered.
"What the heck are you doing? Are you out of your mind?" Kana asked and I was about to say the same thing.
"Not really," he retorted. "But hey, no need to worry. This school is actually a chakushoku."
"Who are you?" I asked using my inner voice and I saw a student who turned her head to our direction with an uneasy expression. "Found you."
"But I remember feeling something odd when I looked at his daughters," sagot niya. "Their skin were quite bluish."
"What happened? Why aren't you moving?" I asked, worried and distraught about his condition.
"N-neuromuscular blocker," he said with difficulty. "P-paralyzing agent."
"This man is a nut job," Kana remarked while digging her nail on her skin.
"Agreed. How should we take him down?"
"Hayate said we should be careful. This guy has medical knowledge and can use it to his advantage just like what happened to Hayate."
"Should we kill him? He's a psycho," Kana suggested but I disagreed.
"No. We should capture him alive and let him suffer the consequences of his actions. Besides, they won't credit that as an arrest and we'd need to catch another one."
"Damn, this is getting harder. If we only have some sedatives to—"
"Whoa, this is a huge-ass needle," Kana commented while looking at the syringe she was holding. "I might pass out when someone injected this to me."

"Kana! Don't! He still has one syringe left!" I yelled but Kana could control her momentum anymore. I ran toward their direction but I wouldn't get there in time so I just threw one of my swords at his direction, hoping that it would stop his movement.
It did but it was already too late.
"H-help me! Kana is . . ."
"5:17:29 P.M. Case closed," I whispered as I looked at the sun setting in the blood-red sky.
"Her vitals are starting to stabilize," Dr. Gardan said and my knees collapsed upon hearing his words. "But we still need to observe her for the next few hours."
"Apologies," Hayate immediately said. "We didn't expect Shinigamis to intervene, so we had to," he explained.
"A-Anyway . . ." I said, breaking the silence. "What happened to the weapons? Where are they?"
